roleset.name: come before, temporally
roleset.note: PREDATE-V NOTES: Roleset based on internet search and WSJ. Member of Vncls contiguous_location-47.8. Comparison to ?precede?. Updated by Julia. (from predate.01-v)

example.name: nice
example.text: John C. Burton, an accounting professor at Columbia University's Graduate School of Business, said ``there's a lot of emotion involved in the name of an accounting firm with a long history and with roots in England, where-1 accounting predates the U.S. *trace*-1.''

example.name: with extent
example.text: [Edison's first sound recordings]-1 were predated *trace*-1 by 20 years.

roleset.name: be a predator of
roleset.note: PREDATE-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. Member of Vncls eat-39.1-1. (from predate.02-v)

roles.note: Arg2 'source' added based on Vncls-- rarely seen (from predate.02-v)

example.name: Intransitive
example.text: It is hoped that the stock of trout will predate sufficiently to minimise the problem.

example.name: All args
example.text: Both species predate fish from pound nets.

roleset.name: mark with a previous date
roleset.note: PREDATE-V NOTES: Roleset by Julia based on internet search. No Vncls. Comparison to ?overestimate?. (from predate.03-v)

example.name: with Arg2 date
example.text: Like Dickinson, he predated his choices back to 1924.

example.name: with Arg2 extent
example.text: He predated the check by three days.
